fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives:
Euromonitor International's quantitative and qualitative research informs EU policy and legislation by providing the evidence to support action. 
Examples include: 
 
Euromonitor International's European tobacco data is used by DGTAXUD's in the evaluation of Directive 2011/64. 
 
Euromonitor International's European tobacco data is also used by DGSANTE's  B2 Unit in the Tobacco Products Directive 2014/40/EC to be able to monitor the impact of the legislation in every EU MS.  
 
Euromonitor International's Packaged Food and Soft Drinks data is used by DG JRC's Directorate F – Health, Consumers to produce technical reports that provide evidence-based scientific support to the European policymaking process on sugar reformulation.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit:
Established in 1972, Euromonitor International is one of the leading providers of market research for industries, economies and consumers.  
 
As an independent company, they offer unmatched detail and unbiased content coverage for 28 consumer goods and service industries. 
 
The information is collected by their own research experts in 100 countries, and provide in-depth analysis at global, regional and national levels required by organisations’ in today’s increasingly competitive international business environment.
position: Senior EU and International Public Sector Adviser
